result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd D Wallschlaeger

defendant.name: Wallschlaeger, Todd D
defendant.address: W141 S7574 Freedom Avenue, Muskego, WI 53150

records.addlTxt:
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no violent contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant ordered to CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services following program protocol for those that are low risk, unless otherwise ordered by the court. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM monitoring.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes

MODIFICATION MADE ON 09/19/2022:
SCRAM requirement is REMOVED. All other requirements remain.

2:35 PM Defendant Todd D Wallschlaeger in court.  Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court for Todd D Wallschlaeger.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim A appears in court in the gallery. 

Defense makes arguments in support of Motion to Modify bond as it relates to removal of SCRAM device. 
State does not oppose motion, but asks that the Court remind the Defendant of the absolute sobriety requirement. 
Victim A makes statements. 

Court will grant the motion to remove the SCRAM requirement, all other requirements remain as set. 
Atty Cotton requests a plea/sentencing hearing in 60 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Motion to Modify Bail, filed by Atty Cotton

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 09/15/2022 - Will address at the 09/19 Hearing.**
Hearing on September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

8:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Todd D Wallschlaeger in court.  Attorney Bradley Novreske for Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court for Todd D Wallschlaeger. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
